title: British racer Danny Watts announces he is homosexual

Why great F1 racing in 2017 would be a fluke There are plenty of predictions that Formula 1's 2017 revamp is going to make the racing less exciting. But even if things are entertaining this year, it would be wrong to hail that as a direct consequence of the changes 1487548800 F1 
Where now for the Williams revival? Williams has had several false dawns since the end of its golden era in 1997, including when it leapt up the order with F1's last major rules changes in 2014. What can it make of this year's new fresh start, and new structure? 1487289600 F1 
What the new Williams tells us about F1 2017 The early images of Williams's FW40 don't reveal the full picture of Formula 1's new rules era, but there are plenty of details to look at in more depth, and some pointers that perhaps the new regulations don't actually go very far 1487289600 F1 
Pegging back Mercedes is a stupid suggestion Toro Rosso boss Franz Tost has suggested Mercedes' engine should be frozen to allow its rivals to catch up. Our resident Fifth Columnist says that is balderdash 1487203200 F1 
The story behind the Mercedes power struggle James Allison is the latest high-profile F1 technical brain to be welcomed into Mercedes. But the journey that led the team to recruiting him carries with it some tales of caution he would do well to be aware of when he starts on March 1 1487203200 F1 
How Toyota the underdog shocked the WRC Most had written off Toyota and its Yaris WRC ahead of 2017.
